page.title: 05Mr.Bainbridge-Other Jobs
page.content: Mr. Bainbridge breeds all his own stock.He keeps 5 bulls,4 beef and 1 dairy for replacement stock.They aim to get one calf per year from each cow.Each lactation lasts about 300 days then she is put into calf again. The fields are dressed with high nitrogen fertilisers to make the grass grow well.It is cut and led to the cows during the summer.In winter the main food is silage which is made from grass in the early summer. It is put in pits and cured. Cows are given concentrates according to the amount of milk they give. Each cow wears a transponder which contains an electronic signal, this is linked to a computer which allocates the correct ammount of food to each cow. Mr. Bainbridge also grows about 40 acres of barley which is also used for feeding.
